# init(content:)

**Initializer**

Creates a chart composed of any number of data series and individual marks.

## Declaration

```swift
nonisolated init(@ChartContentBuilder content: () -> Content)
```

## Parameters

- **content**: A chart content builder that returns the marks that the chart should draw.

## Discussion

This initializer draws the marks that you specify in the `content` input. You can provide individual marks, or marks produced by one or more [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/SwiftUI/ForEach] constructs, or any combination of these. As a convenience when you have exactly one `ForEach` in your chart’s content, you can use either the [doc://com.apple.Charts/documentation/Charts/Chart/init(_:content:)] or [doc://com.apple.Charts/documentation/Charts/Chart/init(_:id:content:)] initializer instead, either of which wraps the content in an implicit `ForEach`.

## Creating a chart

- **init(_:content:)**: Creates a chart composed of a series of identifiable marks.
- **init(_:id:content:)**: Creates a chart composed of a series of marks.

items.description: Creates a chart composed of a series of identifiable marks.
items.name: init(_:content:)

items.description: Creates a chart composed of a series of marks.
items.name: init(_:id:content:)
